column1: Developmental reading disorder is a reading disability that occurs when the brain does not properly recognize and process certain symbols.

It is important for a health care provider to rule out other causes of learning and reading disabilities, such as: - Emotional disorders - Intellectual disability - Brain diseases - Certain cultural and education factors Before diagnosing DRD, the provider will: - Perform a complete medical exam, including a neurological exam.
- Ask if anyone else in the family has had dyslexia.
Learning disorders tend to run in families.
